column4: Is there a way to get over your monitors recommended hz-range? On ubuntu it wont ever go over 85hz, even if i can get 120 up and running on the same resolution in windows.
Im sick of 85hz when i can have 120
recomended ranges are there for a reason
when it says 120 in windows, that doesnt mean its actualy refreshing at 120
my screen says it does
and i can se a difference between 85, 100 and 120
a big difference actually
no you cant
gotten quite spoilt with 120
yes i can
your eye cannot physicaly see over 70ish
compared them alot
you can FEEL a difference above that, but you CANNOT see it
Well, you'll still see a difference
Well, pretty much it.
and i love having 120, and when im used to it going down to 85 is a real bummer
i know its doable since it works in windows
maybe a new programming project perhaps..
removing the manufactuers recommended resolutions ;)
and toasting your monitor
i really dont think its that bad
